forumNotes.author: theclam
forumNotes.content:
I made a VistaPE flash drive and then added on Ubuntu and a couple antivirus rescue discs to make a multiboot USB. Now I want to make DVDs of the USB, but I can't figure out how to do it.  

The problem is that I can't figure out a way to make a DVD bootable. I tried running grubinst on a virtual floppy drive and using an ISO creator to copy the boot image to an ISO containing all the files from the usb drive. That didn't work. It eventually loads a grub command line, instead of loading from my menu.lst file. If I try running the commands from that menu.lst file, it won't boot anything. Then I tried using ImgBurn to extract a boot image and then saving that as an ISO. That didn't work. It just gets me to a black screen with an unblinking cursor. I've been testing it out in Virtual Box, not on a proper DVD, but that shouldn't make a difference.  

Please help!

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
You should create a .iso from the files, NOT from the actual USB stick.  
It is possible, mind you, but it will require "hard disk emulation", something that most BIOSes won't "like".  

Here is a good example for a PE 1.x (bartPE):  
[http://www.911cd.net...showtopic=23262](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=23262 "External link")  

You need to adapt it to the PE 2.x file structure.  

Or, if you want to create one with grub4dos, you use grldr as bootsector in a "no-emulation" CD/DVD:  
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=9696](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=9696 "External link")  

> The problem is that I can't figure out a way to make a DVD bootable. I tried running grubinst on a virtual floppy drive and using an ISO creator to copy the boot image to an ISO containing all the files from the usb drive. That didn't work. It eventually loads a grub command line, instead of loading from my menu.lst file. If I try running the commands from that menu.lst file, it won't boot anything.

Sure it won't find the menu.lst on the floppy.  
The embedded menu.lst in grub4dos has the --ignore-floppies directive.  
You need to change it if you want to follow the "floppy emulation" approach.  
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=7436](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=7436 "External link")  

Same goes for the commands you run, most probably you are using commands that are OK on a USB device but that need modification to run from a CD or (from a bootable floppy emulation used on CD).  

Most notably grub4dos is CaSe SeNsItIvE on CDFS.  

Post your menu.lst (the one that works on the stick) and we can check where the problems are.  

![:D](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/biggrin.png)  
Wonko

forumNotes.content: I got it to work with mkisofs! Thanks.
